title: With 12 days left before midterms, tensions rise between some candidates
description: As the days edge nearer to the 2022 midterm elections, tensions are rising between candidates as races across the US heat up. CNN's Omar Jimenez reports.

title: Damaged plane makes emergency landing after encountering severe weather
description: A LATAM Airlines plane was damaged traveling from Santiago, Chile, to Asunción, Paraguay, and had to make an emergency landing at Silvio Pettirossi International Airport on Wednesday after experiencing "severe weather conditions during its flight path," the airline told CNN in a statement on Thursday.

title: Using sound to take the terror out of nightmares
description: Heart pounding, I sit bolt upright in bed, flushed, sweaty and utterly panicked. My brain has snatched me from a nightmare — a dream so alarming I wake up.

title: Space rock slams into Mars, forming a crater that revealed chunks of ice
description: Christmas came a little early for NASA's InSight mission last December when the lander detected a massive quake on Mars.

title: Putin accuses West of playing 'dangerous, bloody and dirty game'
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin took some familiar swipes at the US and its allies during a speech on Thursday, accusing "Western elites" of playing a "dangerous, bloody and dirty game" and seeking to blame them for much of the world's trouble, including his own invasion of Ukraine.

title: Stabbing attack in Italy kills one, injures soccer star
description: One person has died after a stabbing attack on the outskirts of the Italian city of Milan on Thursday, according to Italian national police.

title: CNN reporter walks through Ukrainian power plant at risk of another Russian attack
description: CNN's Nic Robertson gets an inside look at a Ukrainian power plant that has been damaged by a Russian attack and is still targeted by Russian forces. Workers trying to make repairs are constantly interrupted by air raid sirens.

title: Kanye West has disturbing history of admiring Hitler, sources tell CNN
description: • Kanye West jokes about being dropped by companies

title: US 'concerned' about Russian escalation in Ukraine, defense chief says
Motorcyclist engulfed by flames after being tased by police
description: An Arkansas man is in the hospital -- but expected to recover -- after he was engulfed by a fireball when he was tased by state police while wearing a backpack with a gallon of gasoline inside, according to the Arkansas State Police.

title: US must strengthen defenses in face of increasing threats from China and Russia, strategy says
description: The US must strengthen its defenses against increasing threats from both China and Russia, focusing on Beijing as its main global competitor, the Biden administration's national defense strategy released Thursday says.

title: British PM Rishi Sunak pulls out of COP27 climate summit
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is no longer expected to attend the COP27 climate summit in Egypt next week due to "other pressing commitments," a Downing Street spokesperson said on Thursday.

title: Dad builds scary front door to save candy from trick-or-treaters
description: Monster door threatens to eat trick-or-treaters. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports it greets them with open arms ... literally.

title: 6 new species of rain frogs discovered in Ecuador
description: Six new species of rain frogs have been discovered on the eastern slopes of the Ecuadorian Andes, according to a statement from Ecuador's Ministry of the Environment, Water, and Ecological Transition.

title: Trump lawyers and DOJ are in a sealed court hearing related to Mar-a-Lago investigation Thursday
description: Former President Donald Trump's legal defense team and prosecutors handling the Mar-a-Lago documents investigation are at federal courthouse in Washington, DC, Thursday morning in a secret dispute related to the unprecedented investigation.

title: Surprises rock the Senate races that will decide America's future
description: Late twists are rocking the tight Senate races that will decide the destiny of a chamber now narrowly run by Democrats -- as well as the future direction of America itself -- on Election Day in just 12 days.

title: Russian lawmakers move to toughen 'gay propaganda' law, banning all adults from 'promoting' same-sex relationships
description: Russian lawmakers agreed to toughen the country's discriminatory law against so-called same-sex "propaganda," moving to ban all Russians from promoting or "praising" homosexual relationships or publicly suggesting that they are "normal."

title: Opinion: As winter bites, Putin has a new tactic
description: With evenings drawing in fast as winter approaches, the lights are going out across Ukraine.

title: World's best spicy foods: 20 dishes to try
description: Some like it hot -- and some like it hotter, still.

title: Jules Bass, who brought 'Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer' to TV, dies at 87
description: What kind of Christmas would it be without the resourceful Rudolph or Hermey the aspiring dentist, without friendly Frosty or the dastardly Heat and Snow Misers?

title: These are the women expected to testify against Harvey Weinstein at his second sexual assault trial
description: Reporting five years ago on Harvey Weinstein's alleged sexual abuse spurred women to speak publicly about their own experiences with sexual violence in what became known as the #MeToo movement.

title: Robert Bartini: The world's most mysterious aircraft designer
description: His life is such a mystery that even his real name is uncertain, but his legacy to the world of aviation is clear: Robert Oros di Bartini -- as the inscription reads on his tombstone -- was a genius ahead of his time whose wondrous airplanes and bizarre flying boats still impress today, almost 50 years after his death.

title: See why this chicken salad has gone viral
description: A small deli in Cleveland, Ohio, has gone viral for their chicken salad thanks to a loyal customer's TikTok videos.

title: Elon Musk tells advertisers he doesn't want Twitter to become 'free-for-all hellscape'
description: Elon Musk attempted to reassure Twitter's advertisers about the future of the platform in an open letter Thursday, a day before his $44 billion takeover of the company is expected to be completed.

title: Rivian owners can't help but gush about their trucks, flaws and all
description: Denis Wang says he always hated the car-buying process — until he met Rivian.

title: Israel and Lebanon finalize Mediterranean border agreement, opening up potentially rich oil and gas fields
description: Israel and Lebanon finalized an agreement defining their maritime borders in the Mediterranean on Thursday, President Joe Biden announced on Twitter, inking a United States-brokered deal at the United Nations mission on the land border between the countries.

title: Supplemental breast cancer screening isn't right for all women, experts say
description: When Katie Couric shared the news of her breast cancer diagnosis, the former co-host of NBC's "Today" show said she considered this new health challenge to be a teachable moment to encourage people to get needed cancer screenings.

title: Kanye West jokes about being dropped by companies
European Central Bank raises rates by three quarters of a point and promises more to come
description: The European Central Bank hiked interest rates by three quarters of a percentage point on Thursday, promising further hikes to come as it tackles rising inflation.

title: Dow bursts higher after US economy grows stronger than expected
Barcelona suffer humiliating exit from the Champions League at the hands of Inter Milan and Bayern
description: Barcelona talked a lot about "economic levers" as the Catalan club looks to improve its finances, but it won't be able to use the Champions League pulley anymore after exiting at the competition's group stage for the second consecutive season.

title: Ukrainian power grid hit by Russian strike overnight, says energy agency
description:
• Putin to deliver extensive speech at 'very important' meeting Thursday, Kremlin says
• Watch: Amanpour asks Russian ambassador if nukes are on the table. Hear his response

title: What really happened to Nika Shahkarami? Witnesses to her final hours cast doubt on Iran's story
Judge orders Meadows to testify. Haberman reveals what info he could give prosecutors
description: CNN political analyst Maggie Haberman says Donald Trump's former chief of staff, Mark Meadows, could provide insight into the former president's state of mind about the grand jury investigation in Georgia.

title: Miss USA program under investigation after contestants claim pageant was rigged
description: The Miss Universe Organization has suspended Miss USA President Crystle Stewart and her company, Miss Brand Corporation, pending an independent investigation into allegations that the 2022 Miss USA pageant was rigged.

title: Peloton tells members it will no longer use Kanye West's music in new classes
description: Peloton has "indefinitely paused" playing Kanye West's music from its streaming workout classes.

title: Belarus opposition leader says CNN investigation provides 'proof' Lukashenko regime facilitated Russian aggression in Ukraine
description: An opposition leader in exile from Belarus has demanded that President Alexsandr Lukashenko be held to account for his regime's complicity in the Ukraine war and for Russian soldiers to withdraw from Belarusian soil, after a CNN investigation revealed new evidence that the country provided medical assistance to injured Russian troops.

title: Is the iPhone 14 recession proof? Apple earnings may provide a hint
description: Apple is about to offer its first hints about iPhone 14 sales after weeks of rumors that demand for its latest smartphone lineup could be weaker than initially expected.

title: First on CNN: Senate Democrat warns Fed it's 'foolish' to keep lifting interest rates
description: Colorado Sen. John Hickenlooper is pleading with the Federal Reserve to pause its relentless attack on crushing inflation before it does more harm than good.

title: Prince Harry's long-awaited memoir, 'Spare,' set for January release
description: Prince Harry's highly anticipated memoir will be entitled "Spare" and is set for a January 10 release, its publisher revealed on Thursday.

title: These residents are counted on for votes. But they can't even count on their next meal
description: Access for food has become a central issue in Brazil's presidential election as the country struggles with high inflation, limited growth, and rising poverty. CNN's Paula Newton reports.

title: Emma Raducanu's former coach Dmitry Tursunov says he left because of 'red flags'
description: Dmitry Tursunov says he decided to stop coaching Emma Raducanu at the end of his trial period with the tennis star because of "red flags" that he could not ignore.

title: The robotic falcon designed to help prevent bird strikes
description: Airplanes and birds have been sharing the skies since the first ever flight back in 1903.

title: The peak in global fossil fuel emissions is just around the corner
description: Global fossil fuel emissions are expected to peak in 2025 as countries commit huge sums of money toward low-carbon fuels, according to the International Energy Agency (IEA).

title: German government paves way for legalization of recreational cannabis
description: The German government unveiled plans for the legalization of recreational cannabis for adults on Wednesday, though many details have yet to be worked out and must be squared with European Union law before legislation is put forward.

title: Big Tech can't save your investments
description: Tech stocks are taking a beating this week as they prove less resilient to the economic downturn than investors had hoped they would be.

title: See moment Musk entered Twitter's HQ holding a sink
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who is the process of acquiring Twitter, entered the company's headquarters carrying a sink.

title: Two-time defending MVP Nikola Jokic leads Denver Nuggets to win over the LA Lakers, who fall to 0-4 on the season
description: Two-time defending NBA MVP Nikola Jokic dominated on Wednesday night, nearly racking up a triple-double with 31 points, 13 rebounds, nine assists and four steals in the Denver Nuggets' 110-99 victory against the struggling Los Angeles Lakers, who are now 0-4 on the season.

title: Shell announces $4 billion share buyback as profits double
description: Shell will buy back $4 billion worth of shares and increase its dividend by 15% after posting another gigantic quarterly profit thanks to strong oil and gas prices.

title: Russia tries to halt a UN probe into use of Iranian-made drones in Ukraine
Protesters bring traffic to a standstill
description: Clashes broke out throughout Iran as protesters marked 40 days since the death of Mahsa Amini. Amini's death back in September has sparked worldwide upset. CNN's Nada Bashir reports.

title: Phil Mickelson says Saudi-backed LIV Golf series is 'not going away'
description: Veteran golfer Phil Mickelson says the controversial LIV Golf series is a "force" in the sport and it's "not going away."

title: Tree of Life survivors working to root out antisemitism 4 years after deadliest assault on Jewish people in the US
description: Four years after a synagogue attack that forever changed her life, Andrea Wedner hopes to inspire the next generation to root out antisemitism amid continued reports of anti-Jewish bigotry.

title: These Floridians were hit by Hurricane Ian a month ago. Here's what FEMA has done for them so far
description: A month after Hurricane Ian swept across Florida, Ciry Sosa and her family are still living in the Fort Myers Beach apartment where the dirty salt water rose up to 4 feet, destroying most of their belongings and leaving behind mold on the walls. They are sleeping on air mattresses and relying on donations of food, clothes and other essentials from neighbors and community groups.

title: Walker to be joined by Cruz in Georgia as GOP stands by its man after new abortion allegation
description: With less than two weeks until Election Day and Georgia voters casting early ballots in record numbers, Republican Senate candidate Herschel Walker will be back on the trail Thursday followed again by clouds of scandal surrounding a new allegation he pressured a woman into having an abortion.

title: Rifle used in the St. Louis school shooting had been taken from the gunman days before the attack, police say
description: The AR-15-style rifle used in the deadly St. Louis school shooting had been taken from the shooter's possession during a domestic disturbance just days before the attack, and it's unclear how he got it, police say.

title: Are microcars the smaller, greener future of urban driving?
description: Cities around the world are taking steps to clear their streets.

title: TNF preview: 'The GOAT' Tom Brady and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers host the Baltimore Ravens
description: Tom Brady and Lamar Jackson may be 20 years apart in age, but both quarterbacks have a special bond.

title: Black and poor women may decide who will be the next president of Brazil
UK foreign secretary under fire for saying LGBT soccer fans should be "respectful" at Qatar World Cup
description: British Foreign Secretary James Cleverly is receiving backlash for suggesting gay soccer fans should be "respectful" in Qatar when attending the FIFA World Cup set to take place in the Gulf Arab state later this year.

title: 'The Headies:' An inside look at the show celebrating Afrobeats artists
description: In September, Ayo Animashaun found himself halfway around the world facing a pivotal moment in his career. The Nigerian entrepreneur and music executive was bringing his country's biggest music awards show, The Headies, to the United States for the first time — and failure wasn't an option.

title: Credit Suisse announces 'radical' restructuring with Saudi backing
description: Credit Suisse will raise $4 billion to step back from Wall Street and double down on managing the finances of the world's wealthy, the scandal-plagued Swiss bank said on Thursday.

title: The biggest health insurance mysteries, and how to decode them
description: Whether you're getting kicked off your parent's health insurance plan or have been doing open enrollment for years, navigating health insurance jargon can be daunting.

title: Black and poor women may decide who will be the next president of Brazil
description: • Brazil's election explained: Lula and Bolsonaro face off in high stakes vote

title: Thai tycoon and transgender rights advocate buys Miss Universe for $20 million
description: A Thai media tycoon and transgender rights advocate has bought the Miss Universe Organization for $20 million, according to her company, which will now host the international beauty pageant.

title: Iran says it wasn't behind Nika Shahkarami's death. But videos and testimony obtained by CNN raise fresh questions about officials' claims
Exclusive evidence shows protester was chased and then detained by police before disappearance
description: Nika Shahkarami has become one of the most known faces in Iran after she went missing on September 20 after attending protests in Tehran. Iranian authorities claimed she fell from a building later that night in an incident unconnected to the protests. But by analyzing over 50 videos obtained by CNN and speaking to six eyewitnesses, CNN has exclusive evidence that Nika was chased and then detained by police just a few hours before she went missing. CNN'S Katie Polglase reports.

title: Samsung names billionaire scion Jay Y. Lee as chairman
description: Samsung has appointed Jay Y. Lee, its longtime de facto leader, as executive chairman.

title: CNN witnesses Russia return body of American fighting for Ukraine
description: In a CNN exclusive, Clarissa Ward travels to the Zaporizhzhia region between Ukrainian and Russian-controlled Ukraine, where Russian officials return the remains of Joshua Jones, an American killed while fighting for Ukraine.

title: Singapore jails man who posed as female gynecologist on Facebook to get intimate photos
description: A man who fooled dozens of women into sending him photos of their genitalia by posing as a female gynecologist on Facebook has been sentenced to jail in Singapore.

title: CNN employees brace for layoffs after network chief warns of 'unsettling' changes ahead
description: "Unsettling."

title: Tapper on the 'paradox' of Putin: 'The more he fails, the more desperate he becomes'
description: CNN's Jake Tapper breaks down the latest developments of Russia's war in Ukraine, including a rare ceasefire as Russia returned the body of an American killed fighting alongside Ukrainians.

title: 'Absolute f**king hell': Putin's front line soldiers reeling in new video
description: In a video shared by a Ukrainian journalist, Russian soldiers appear to be complaining that they do not have the basic tools to survive on the front lines. CNN cannot independently verify the video.

title: Watch these men pose as officials and try to copy 2020 election data from a voting machine
description: CNN's Drew Griffin reports on the two men, one armed and in a bulletproof vest, who showed up at the Cross Village, Michigan, community center claiming to be from the Department of Defense and tried to copy 2020 election data from a voting machine in an attempt to investigate baseless claims of voter fraud.

title: Jury discharged in high-profile Australia rape trial due to juror's external research
description: An Australian judge has dismissed a 12-member jury considering their verdict in a high-profile rape trial after it was revealed a juror conducted research into the allegations and took that information into the jury room.

title: How to build supertall: Designers of the world's tallest towers share their secrets
description: The world's tallest building casts a long shadow. For more than a decade now, the 828-meter (2,717 ft) high Burj Khalifa has reigned over Dubai's skyline and architecture's collective conscious. It didn't just break the record; 62% taller than its predecessor, Taipei 101, it obliterated it. Its legacy has been remarkable -- and remarkably useful to the man who designed it.
